body:
And I notice the files:

- `sharding-core/sharding-core-optimize/src/main/java/org/apache/shardingsphere/core/optimize/sharding/segment/select/item/engine/SelectItemsEngine.java` is missing test coverage.
- `sharding-orchestration/sharding-orchestration-core/src/main/java/org/apache/shardingsphere/orchestration/internal/util/IpUtils.java ` is with test coverage reduction.

Could you add test cases on those two files?
I notice this pr only add some new keywords but not handle with  srs and trigger, do you miss commit some codes?

Unit tests need assert automatically, otherwise nobody will notice performance is slow at the moment.

Can jmh auto assert if benchmark under threshold?
Will close soon if no response anymore.
Will close soon if no response anymore.
Will close soon if no response anymore.

broadcast tables is for sharding feature, round robin is for master-slave feature, they don't have relationship each other, they should not occur together.
What's your expected?
duplicate with #2548

No.
The curator version is the last version that JDK 7 supported.
ShardingSphere will upgrade JDK version after version 4.0.0 release.
Document is correct, problem was solved.

I think it needs, for example, a table is a foreign key of another table, you need to get the ID, and the distributed primary key that comes with it does not need to configure the workid. Is there any problem with multiple microservices inserting data at the same time?

> Will close soon if no response anymore.


The extra logs are the same. I hope the author can solve this bug as soon as possible, because I think it is a few bugs that are easy to reproduce. I and my friends around me say that it is a bug in sharding-jdbc. In fact, mycat also has such a bug, the reason is also because of the sorting problem, please refer to https://blog.csdn.net/u013235478/article/details/53178657 for details.
However, I think there is a way to solve this problem. For example, first pass the total number of couns, then calculate the offset, and then rewrite sql. It can also solve the non-ID fragmentation, but sharding-jdbc does not. Provide such a function.

```
.....

        *
        FROM t_user_97 as u

```

Original sql

```
2019-08-04 15:13:31.387 [http-nio-8210-exec-1] DEBUG com.UserMapper.selectByExample - ==>  Preparing: select * from t_user WHERE 1=1 AND insert_time  >=? AND insert_time <=? limit ? offset ? 
2019-08-04 15:13:31.387 [http-nio-8210-exec-1] DEBUG com.UserMapper.selectByExample - ==> Parameters: 2019-01-27T00:00:00.000+0800, 2019-08-04T23:59:59.000+0800,10(Integer), 852740(Integer)
```

To reproduce this problem, you can set the java startup parameters as follows -ea -Xmx128m -Xms64m -XX:+HeapDumpOnOutOfMemoryError -XX:HeapDumpPath=E:\heap_dump.log, remember that the database is postgresql, if the author feels trouble can use docker When creating a database, just a command, docker run --name my-pgsmaster --restart always -p 5432:5432 -e POSTGRES_PASSWORD=youpassword --privileged -itd postgres, I hope the author can solve this problem as soon as possible. The questions I mentioned are all used in my development or production. I wanted to use the 4x version directly, but I have not got a stable version.
I found the place where the exception was thrown by analyzing the heap_dump.log as follows:

ComplexKeysShardingAlgorithm is to process the sharding case in which multiple sharding keys are used; ComplexShardingStrategy needs to be used together. It has a relatively complex logic that requires developers to deal by themselves.

FYI: https://shardingsphere.apache.org/document/current/en/features/sharding/concept/sharding/

for example:
sharding.jdbc.config.sharding.default-datasource-name=ds0
Can you upload the packages captured by tcpdump?

> ComplexKeysShardingAlgorithm is to process the sharding case in which multiple sharding keys are used; ComplexShardingStrategy needs to be used together. It has a relatively complex logic that requires developers to deal by themselves.
> 
> FYI: https://shardingsphere.apache.org/document/current/en/features/sharding/concept/sharding/

I know how to use it . 
I mean i use ComplexShardingStrategy with two colums , and one colums is datetime type.
when i execute this sql
   select * from table_a where colum_a='' and colum_b between time1 and time2
will throw  exception like this :
org.apache.shardingsphere.core.strategy.route.value.BetweenRouteValue cannot be cast to org.apache.shardingsphere.core.strategy.route.value.ListRouteValue

I find other issue the same with me , and i known it is a bug in 4.0.0-RC1 version. 
I just want to avoid it in my projection.

3Q for you answer.
I use equal replace between and .and i hope this bug can be fixed next version

I don't know the implementation of MyCat, but I think ShardingSphere don't have the problem.

ShardingSphere provide ways to save memory. Please follow the instructions below to reduce the memory cost.

1. Make a stream ResultSet:
**statement.setFetchSize(1);** 
or
jdbc:postgresql://127.0.0.1:5432/demo?**defaultRowFetchSize=1**

2. Make sure the ExecuteEngine in MEMORY_STRICTLY Mode:
I noticed your SQL will be full routed to 200 nodes. (Everyone need to avoid full routing)
Any way, set the props max.connections.size.per.query more than 200. For example:
**max.connections.size.per.query: 300**

After 1&2, both jdbc and ShardingSphere will not fetch all data in memory.

For more details: 
https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s?__biz=MzUzNjgwODk2Mw==&mid=2247483679&idx=1&sn=ee7335b72b9105a53a55ee59b42358b1&chksm=faf1da73cd8653656b0c56ba852a98d67eb67f4f36e294a8c08507f5c3dc3b6897a90b99ea53&scene=0&key=4062b15c04f483fc1db8d4359b898767266e0bca63e1553ea724f2bf8a298d9cb0562f695b0804411c278e9e3db279cf63de75965c6f84781027c9ab8495334243939bbfc2f8ee21bacda90671addb29&ascene=1&uin=MTM1ODcxNDE1&devicetype=Windows+7&version=62060833&lang=zh_CN&pass_ticket=CdqzKWxf9iryvwQkRSxKqGt8Wz3LIqnQyhtmzMOC6eY%3D

> Unit tests need assert automatically, otherwise nobody will notice performance is slow at the moment.
> 
> Can jmh auto assert if benchmark under threshold?

of course
Please search `Unsupported major.minor version 52.0` to find solution.
Please read error message: `ERROR: null value in column "id" violates not-null constraint` and try to understander it fist before submit an issue.

> > 
> > Could you add test cases on those two files?
> 
> HI, I don'k know why `IpUtils`'s coverage is reduced, because I haven't modify anywhere in `IpUtils`. In [report](https://coveralls.io/builds/24978607/source?filename=sharding-orchestration%2Fsharding-orchestration-core%2Fsrc%2Fmain%2Fjava%2Forg%2Fapache%2Fshardingsphere%2Forchestration%2Finternal%2Futil%2FIpUtils.java#L64), `isPublicIpAddress()` return false, so next code can not be covered. I think maybe check environment is changed.
> 
> ```java
>                 if (isPublicIpAddress(ipAddress)) {
>                     String publicIpAddress = ipAddress.getHostAddress();
>                     cachedIpAddress = publicIpAddress;
>                     return publicIpAddress;
>                 }
> ```
> 
> @terrymanu Can you give me some advice?

This is not test coverage decrease, it is missing test.
Did you modify this class? If not, we can just leave it there.
I didn't modify it.
Duplicate with #1497, #2225, #2745 and #2810
How to do it, could you add more jmh test cases on this pr?

For example, There is a table `dict` on the Host A and Host B, I configured dict as a broadcast table. The query always send to Host A (with out join). All of the broadcast tables‘ s query always send to Host A. No query send to Host B. 
Is there any way i can configure round robin routing of broadcast table? `Mycat` is round robin routing.
Sorry, we just focus ShardingSphere, I don't know for other project.
For broadcast table, the best practice is join with sharding tables. If not, you may create a independent datasource to handle dict table.
Will close soon if nobody interesting this feature for now.

I understand someone need this feature. but we have no plan to do this for now.
So I just open this issue for serval days, if anybody interesting this feature, we can discuss more details.
Will close soon if nobody interesting this feature for now.

>

> 
> 1. Make a stream ResultSet:
>    **statement.setFetchSize(1);**

> 2. Make sure the ExecuteEngine in MEMORY_STRICTLY Mode:

1. In fact, mycat also has this problem, the official is also recommended to use id query and then pagination, it is not recommended to directly page.
2.Sharding-Proxy does not support postgresql
3. Some more complicated queries, I think ShardingSphere has more advantages, because some queries I need to use stored procedures, I have written a set of business rules tool class, can directly get the specified data source directly from ShardingDataSource and then execute through JdbcTemplate .
4. The answer you provided is not the same question that I am asking. The question I asked is ShardingSphere page sorting. Because the memory is too large, the memory leaks, and you send a ShardingSphere principle and optimization process.
5. I have doubted whether the mqsql driver and the postgresql driver are inconsistent. It may be that mysql does not get all the data at once, and the postgresql driver may acquire all the data at a time, and then perform the memory and return, which leads to a one-time query. 8000000 data out of memory caused memory overflow, I tried to increase the java memory, and then did not crash, but when returned, the query is super slow, I spent more than 8 seconds from the beginning to the end of the data query, this is unacceptable If multiple concurrent calls will cause the same problem, memory overflows.
6. Actually, I have thought about the solution.
     First, it is preloading a number of data and then paging according to id.
     Second, or synchronize the data to mongodb or ElasticSearch, but postgresql is not the same as mysql, can not directly resolve binlog, and the server is Alibaba Cloud, if using mq as compensation and frequently update the table data, resulting in business is extremely complicated , but also involves the order before and after, if the use of sequential messages involves the issue of fast consumption, of course, I can specify the channel.
7. The service has been routed to the smallest possible table, but there are still more than 100 tables. I used multiple routes depending on the business.

8. I have tried your configuration above, but this time it is a lot better, the system does not crash, but because the processing time is too long, the database timeout, if a large number of links, will drag the database. The error message is as follows:

`java.sql.SQLTransientConnectionException: HikariPool-3 - Connection is not available, request timed out after 30000ms.`

Maybe you don't understand. Just follow the instructions. And feedback whether there's still "memory leak".

**statement.setFetchSize(1);** 
or
jdbc:postgresql://127.0.0.1:5432/demo?**defaultRowFetchSize=1**

2. Make sure the ExecuteEngine in MEMORY_STRICTLY Mode:

**max.connections.size.per.query: 300**

`java.sql.SQLTransientConnectionException: HikariPool-3 - Connection is not available, request timed out after 30000ms.`
I suppose there are 200 connections to MySQL. So please check the max connections of HikariCP and MySQL server. Both of them must more than 200.

##### 💛  - [Coveralls](https://coveralls.io)

> I suppose there are 200 connections to MySQL. So please check the max connections of HikariCP and MySQL server. Both of them must more than 200.

Not the larger the number of database connections, the better the database has a limit on the number of connections. Generally speaking, postgresql exceeds 800 for obvious performance problems. Plus, our service is distributed cluster, and a service if it is behind 200 As you can imagine, I think this is a solution that cannot solve the problem. You can refer to the following article:
https://www.jianshu.com/p/a8f653fc0c54
https://blog.csdn.net/X5fnncxzq4/article/details/80649679
Increasing the number of connections does not solve the timeout problem, and when the amount of data is read to a certain amount, even if it does not time out, it will encounter a memory overflow problem.

I just checked the timeout again because I set max.connections.size.per.query: 300. I think it should be executing 300 query requests at a time, resulting in a large number of concurrent, and queued, the database will time out, put This is reduced, the program is normally allowed, otherwise querying a cout before paging will cause the database connection pool to time out java.sql.SQLTransientConnectionException: HikariPool-3 - Connection is not available, request timed out after 30000ms.

Maybe you don't understand. Why not follow the instructions. And feedback whether there's still SQLTransientConnectionException.

I suppose there are x connections to PostgreSQL. So please check the max connections of HikariCP and PostgreSQL server. Both of them must more than x.

@terrymanu 
Yes, broadcast table is used to join with sharding tables, but it is also used to without join.
`SELECT o.id,d.value FROM order o LEFT JOIN dict d ON o.type=d.value WHERE o.id=?`, If the `order` data is on `Host A`, the query will send to `Host A`, or the data is on `Host B`, send to `Host B`, That is okay.
`SELECT * FROM dict WHERE id = ?`, This is always send to Host A, The loading is always on the Host A.

> Maybe you don't understand. Why not follow the instructions. And feedback whether there's still SQLTransientConnectionException.
> 
> I suppose there are x connections to PostgreSQL. So please check the max connections of HikariCP and PostgreSQL server. Both of them must more than x.

I just set the property to max.connections.size.per.query: 5, or there is a memory leak, defaultRowFetchSize=1 is also set.

Tell me how many connections will be created by the full routing? Or directly show me the shardingRule and datasources. Let's suppose the number is x to save time.

Hi @rimal, if `databaseShardingValues ` is empty means that there are no sharding column in your SQL. In this case, ShardingSphere will do full routing in design.
The behaviour can't be overrode whether in `ComplexKeysShardingAlgorithm ` or `ComplexKeysShardingAlgorithm `.

We don't talk about how many connections is right for now. You can choose less memory cost or less connections cost, but you can't choose both of them. Full routing is not the correct design, if you insist full routing, you have to trade off.

> Have you missed my question? "So, there's no SQLTransientConnectionException?"

The program does not throw a SQLTransientConnectionException, but directly OutOfMemoryError, I am sure that when I query the unfragmented table, I did not throw OutOfMemoryError, and I will not appear OutOfMemoryError when querying the first page, even the first few hundred pages of data. , but throw OutOfMemoryError if you directly page to 899999 pages

There's only one row in the memory per ResultSet at a time since you set **defaultRowFetchSize=1**.
One row can't lead to an OutOfMemoryError. Please analyze what's in the memory.
In case of misunderstanding, show me the current shardingRule and datasources.

Here are some new findings.

For MySQL statement.setFetchSize() is enough to make a stream ResultSet. 
But for PostgreSQL there's another condition(I missed before) to make the ResultSet stream. After I checked the document, I found the condition:
**conn.setAutoCommit(false);**

I believe the OutOfMemoryError is caused by the lack of this condition, so please modify your code and try again.

Make a stream ResultSet for pgjdbc:
1. **statement.setFetchSize(1);**
    or
    jdbc:postgresql://127.0.0.1:5432/demo?**defaultRowFetchSize=1**
2. **conn.setAutoCommit(false);**

You can find the example code for turn on/off stream ResultSet via PostgreSQL document: 
https://jdbc.postgresql.org/documentation/head/query.html#query-with-cursor

@terrymanu Thanks for your reply.

Honestly, I see Sharding JDBC as a layer over my datasource. I believe that since Sharding JDBC is actually a part of the application and not something in between the application and the database (like ProxySQL), Sharding JDBC is much more powerful as it can let me shard via an application logic as well and not only on basis of the SQL.

Also, I ll try to shed some light on my use case:

- I have a multi-tenant application and we are sharding by tenant identifier. 
- Almost all requests served by the application are within the scope of the tenant.
- Not all queries have the sharding column  (in my case, the tenant identifier). 
- If the query has sharding column, i will want to decide the target name as per that.
- Otherwise, I will fetch tenant information from the current request being served by the application, and then decide target name from that 

I have a patch in my mind which should resolve this use case. If it will be ok, i can submit that as a pull request.
Beside Sharding-JDBC, ShardingSphere also include Sharding-Proxy, we want make same behavior with those 2 products except different access layer (JDBC or database protocol).

I prefer support multi-tenants to high level of Sharding-JDBC, which can make ShardingSphere as a infrastructure of data-sharding.

How about add a new module to handle multi-tenants upper of basic sharding feature?

> I thinks you can study groovy script first and try to use the script to calculate the routing result.

Sorry, I have no idea yet. Can you give me some advice?

> Beside Sharding-JDBC, ShardingSphere also include Sharding-Proxy, we want make same behavior with those 2 products except different access layer (JDBC or database protocol).

That is a fair point. 

What if we let the `ShardingStrategy` decide what to do if `shardingValues` is empty or not. Currently, `StandardRoutingEngine` does not even call the `ShardingStrategy` is `shardingValues` are empty. 

I have submitted a pull request with the above implementation. Will it be possible for you to check it once and see if it makes sense ?
